intro: Boechera tenuis, commonly known as the narrowleaf rockcress, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbages. This plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in alpine or arctic environments. Boechera tenuis is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers and narrow, grass-like leaves. It is a perennial herb that is often found in open, sunny habitats.
